release.action: Class BasicDescription is no longer final.
Class Formatting and its methods are now public.
Added method 'isNotEqualByComparingTo' to BigDecimalAssert.
Assertion classes are no longer final. Constructors are now protected, instead of package-protected.
Class org.fest.assertions.Assertions are no longer final. Constructor is now protected, instead of private.
Added methods 'is(Condition)' and 'isNot(Condition)' to all assertion classes. These methods are aliases for 'satisfies(Condition)' and 'doesNotSatisfy(Condition)' respectively.
All assertions now throw ComparisonFailure if comparison of two objects fail and JUnit is in the classpath.
ImageAssert no longer uses the constructor IOException(String, Throwable) from JDK 1.6.
Fixed inconsistency in parameter naming.
Reorganized tests and migrated to JUnit.
Fixed error message displayed when two Strings are not equal and JUnit is in the classpath.
Descriptions of actual values are evaluated only if an assertion fails.
Methods 'satisfies(Condition)' and 'doesNotSatisfy(Condition)' in all assertions now throw NullPointerException instead of IllegalArgumentException if the given condition is null.
Method 'hasSameContentAs(File)' in FileAssert now throws NullPointerException instead of IllegalArgumentException if the given File is null.
Methods 'includes(Entry...)' and 'excludes(Entry...)' in MapAssert now throws NullPointerException instead of IllegalArgumentException if any of the values in the given Entry array is null.
Method 'hasSize(Dimension)' in ImageAssert now throws NullPointerException instead of IllegalArgumentException if the given Dimension is null.
Method 'read(String)' in ImageAssert now throws NullPointerException if the given path is null.
Method 'isInstanceOf(Class)' in ObjectAssert now throws NullPointerException instead of IllegalArgumentException if the given type is null.
Method 'isInstanceOfAny(Class...)' in ObjectAssert now throws NullPointerException instead of IllegalArgumentException if the given array is null.
Method 'isInstanceOfAny(Class...)' in ObjectAssert now throws NullPointerException instead of IllegalArgumentException if the any element in the given array is null.
Method 'contains(Object, Index)' in ListAssert now throws NullPointerException instead of AssertionError if the given Index is null.
Method 'contains(Object, Index)' in ListAssert now throws IndexOutOfBoundsException instead of AssertionError if the value in the given Index is out of bounds.
Added method 'overridingErrorMessage(String)' that allows users to specify custom error messages, replacing the default ones.
When two objects are compared with 'isEqualTo' and the comparison fails, a ComparisonFailure is thrown using the 'toString' implementation of the compared objects.
Deprecated static inner class Delta in FloatAssert. It is replaced by top-level class org.assertions.Delta.
Deprecated method 'value' in class Delta. Replaced with method 'doubleValue'.
Removed method 'size' from GroupAssert. This method should have been removed before releasing 1.0.
Added class ListAssert.
Added method 'isEqualTo(double[], Delta)' to DoubleArrayAssert.
Converted inner class Delta in DoubleArrayAssert to a top-level class. Inner class Delta has been deprecated and it will be removed in v. 2.0.
Method 'isEqualTo(Object[])' in ObjectArrayAssert now uses java.util.Arrays.deepEquals(Object[], Object[]) to compare two arrays.
Added method 'isEqualTo(BufferedImage, Threshold)' which tolerates a certain amount of color differences when comparing two images for equality.
Package-protected classes Assert, GenericAssert and GroupAssert are now public.
Package-protected methods in classes Assert, GenericAssert and GroupAssert are now protected.
Added method 'doesNotHaveDuplicates(Object...)' to ObjectArrayAssert.
Renamed method 'contains(Entry...)' to 'includes(Entry...)' to MapAssert.
Assertions for primitive values can also be created from primitive wrappers.
Added interface org.fest.assertions.Description.
Added methods 'as(Description)' and 'describedAs(Description)' to all assertions.
Removed class ThrowableAssert.CauseHierarchyAssert.
Removed methods 'message', 'causeHierarchy' and 'cause' from ThrowableAssert.
Removed method 'size' from FileAssert.
Exceptions thrown by methods 'satisfies' and 'doesNotSatisfy' include the name of Condition class if the Condition's description is not specified.
Added method 'doesNotSatisfy' to all assertions.
Patch: Added support for BigDecimal.

Added method 'isEmptyOrNull' to BooleanArrayAssert, ByteAssertArray, CharArrayAssert, CollectionAssert, DoubleArrayAssert, FloatArrayAssert, IntArrayAssert, LongArrayAssert, MapAssert, ShortArrayAssert and StringAssert.
Added fest-mocks-0.1 and fest-test-0.1 as a 'test' scoped dependencies.
Added method 'message' to ThrowableAssert. This method returns a StringAssert.
Added method 'hasMessage(String)' to ThrowableAssert.
Added method 'size' to FileAssert. This method returns a LongAssert.
Fixed bug in FileContentComparator where EOF (end of file) was determined at the wrong time.

Replaced methods 'hasCauseAsAncestor' and 'hasExactCauseAsAncestor' in ThrowableAssert with the methods 'hasCauseOfType' and 'hasCauseOfExactType' in CauseHierarchyAssert. To get a CauseHierarchyAssert, users need to call the method 'causeHierarchy' in ThrowableAssert.

Replaced method 'hasCauseOfType' in ThrowableAssert with method 'cause', which returns another ThrowableAssert for the cause of the actual Throwable. Users can call 'isInstanceOf' in the returned ThrowableAssert.
Method 'isInstanceOf' in ObjectAssert and ThrowableAssert throws IllegalArgumentException if the given Class is null.
Method 'isInstanceOfAny' in ObjectAssert throws IllegalArgumentException if the given Class array is null or if any element in the given Class array is null.
Fixed typos in Javadocs for class PrimitiveFail.
Removed dependency on Apache Velocity.
Removed code generators for assertions for primitive arrays and failure methods for primitives.
Added missing declaration of exceptions in Javadocs.
Eliminated inconsistencies and typos in exception messages.
Error messages in ObjectArrayAssert and all the assertion objects dealing with array of primitives where including the description of the assertion object twice.
Error messages in ObjectArrayAssert were using quotes around array of Strings.
Updated dependency 'fest-util' to version 0.3.
Improved Javadoc documentation of the methods 'as' and 'describedAs' in all assertion classes.
Added method 'assertThat(Iterator)' to Assertions. This method returns a CollectionAssert.
Added methods 'hasAllElementsOfType' and 'hasAtLeastOneElementOfType' to ObjectArrayAssert.
Added check 'isNotNull' to all the methods in all assertion objects that deal with not-null actual values.
Changed access of protected methods to package-protected.
Patch: added methods 'isEqualTo' and 'isNotEqualTo' to BooleanAssert.
Patch: added methods 'matches' and 'doesNotMatch' to StringAssert.
Patch: added methods 'isRelative' and 'isAbsolute' to FileAssert.
Added method 'assertThat(Map)' to Assertions. This method returns a MapAssert.
Patch: added class MapAssert.
Patch: added methods 'greaterOrEqualTo' and 'lessOrEqualTo' to ByteAssert, CharAssert, DoubleAssert, FloatAssert, IntAssert, LongAssert and ShortAssert.
Patch: added methods 'startsWith' and 'endsWith' to StringAssert.
Patch: added class method 'isInstanceOf' to ThrowableAssert.
Patch: added class method 'hasSameContentAs' to FileAssert.
Added method 'size()' to GroupAssert. This method returns an IntAssert.
Added method 'excludes' to StringAssert.
Patch: added class FileAssert.
Patch: added class ThrowableAssert.
Expected and actual values were in wrong order when creating a ComparisonFailure.
Added a generified overload of 'assertThat' to class Assertions.
Added a delta value for floating point equality in 'DoubleAssert' and 'FloatAssert'.
Created Maven-generated site to replace Google Code's wiki pages.
Fixed incorrect test for floating point equality in 'DoubleArrayAssert' and 'FloatArrayAssert'.

Added method 'containsOnly' to all assertion objects that handle arrays or collections. This method verifies that the actual array or collection contains all the given values and only the given values.
Support for JUnit's ComparisonFailure.
Added method 'contains' to all assertion objects that handle arrays or collections. This method verifies that the actual array or collection contains the given values.
Added method 'excludes' to all assertion objects that handle arrays or collections. This method is the opposite of 'contains'.
All assertion objects override 'equals(Object)', which now throws 'UnsupportedOperationException' to prevent accidental calls.
Introduced method 'describedAs' as a counterpart to 'as'. This issue prevented to use the method 'as' in Groovy ('as' is a keyword in Groovy).
Fixed minor bug in assertion classes for arrays (Object and primitives) where the actual and expected values where in the wrong order in the failure message of 'isEqualTo'.
Introduced method 'as' to describe the actual value in the assertion.
Added support for extensibility using Conditions.
